chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
P: SF_seq -> Type

Goal:
(forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s

Premises:
SF_cons = fun (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := fst h; SF_t := (SF_h s, snd h) :: SF_t s |} : R * T -> SF_seq -> SF_seq
SF_nil = fun x0 : R => {| SF_h := x0; SF_t := [::] |} : R -> SF_seq Argument scope is [R_scope]
*** [ R : Set ]
Record SF_seq : Type := mkSF_seq { SF_h : R; SF_t : seq (R * T) } For mkSF_seq: Argument scopes are [R_scope seq_scope]
unzip2_rcons : forall (s : seq (?S * ?T)) (h : ?S * ?T), unzip2 (rcons s h) = rcons (unzip2 s) (snd h) where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
seq_ind2 : forall P0 : seq ?S -> seq ?T -> Type, P0 [::] [::] -> (forall (x : ?S) (y : ?T) (s : seq ?S) (t : seq ?T), size s = size t -> P0 s t -> P0 (x :: s) (y :: t)) -> forall (s : seq ?S) (t : seq ?T), size s = size t -> P0 s t where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
Ring_polynom.Pol_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Prop), (forall c : C, P (Ring_polynom.Pc c)) -> (forall (p : positive) (p0 : Ring_polynom.Pol C), P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.Pinj p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.Pol C, P p -> forall (p0 : positive) (p1 : Ring_polynom.Pol C), P p1 -> P (Ring_polynom.PX p p0 p1)) -> forall p : Ring_polynom.Pol C, P p
size_unzip1 : forall s : seq (?T * ?T0), size (unzip1 s) = size s where ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T0 : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
last_unzip1 : forall (x0 : ?S) (y0 : ?T) (s : seq (?S * ?T)), last x0 (unzip1 s) = fst (last (x0, y0) s) where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
well_founded_induction_type_2 : forall (A B : Type) (R : A * B -> A * B -> Prop) (P : A -> B -> Type), well_founded R -> (forall (x : A) (x' : B), (forall (y : A) (y' : B), R (y, y') (x, x') -> P y y') -> P x x') -> forall (a : A) (b : B), P a b
Build_Filter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), F (fun _ : T => True) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x)) -> (forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q) -> Filter F
filter_prod_ind : forall (T U : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : T * U -> Prop) (P0 : Prop), (forall (Q : T -> Prop) (R : U -> Prop), F Q -> G R -> (forall (x : T) (y : U), Q x -> R y -> P (x, y)) -> P0) -> filter_prod F G P -> P0
Fix_F_2 : forall (A B : Type) (R : A * B -> A * B -> Prop) (P : A -> B -> Type), (forall (x : A) (x' : B), (forall (y : A) (y' : B), R (y, y') (x, x') -> P y y') -> P x x') -> forall (x : A) (x' : B), Acc R (x, x') -> P x x'
unzip1_fst : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 s = [seq fst i | i <- s] where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
unzip2_snd : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip2 s = [seq snd i | i <- s] where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
filter_imp : forall P0 Q : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P0 x -> Q x) -> ?F P0 -> ?F Q where ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?F : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?Filter : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Filter ?F]
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : seq A -> Prop), P [::] -> (forall (a : A) (l : seq A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : seq A, P l
unzip1_behead : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 (behead s) = behead (unzip1 s) where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
unzip2_belast : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip2 (belast s) = belast (unzip2 s) where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
unzip2_behead : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip2 (behead s) = behead (unzip2 s) where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
unzip1_belast : forall s : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 (belast s) = belast (unzip1 s) where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
Relation_Operators.swapprod_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : A * A -> A * A -> Prop), (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> P (x, y) p) -> (forall (x y : A) (p : A * A), Relation_Operators.symprod A A R R (x, y) p -> P (y, x) p) -> forall p p0 : A * A, Relation_Operators.swapprod A R p p0 -> P p p0
Build_ProperFilter : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), (forall P : T -> Prop, F P -> exists x : T, P x) -> Filter F -> ProperFilter F
zip_cons : forall (hs : ?S) (ht : ?T) (s : seq ?S) (t : seq ?T), zip (hs :: s) (ht :: t) = (hs, ht) :: zip s t where ?S : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
Filter_prod : forall (F : (?T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (?U -> Prop) -> Prop) (P0 : ?T * ?U -> Prop) (Q : ?T -> Prop) (R : ?U -> Prop), F Q -> G R -> (forall (x : ?T) (y : ?U), Q x -> R y -> P0 (x, y)) -> filter_prod F G P0 where ?T : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type] ?U : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Type]
prod_rect : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> Type), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
prod_rec : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> Set), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
prod_ind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> Prop), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
prod_sind : forall (A B : Type) (P : A * B -> SProp), (forall (a : A) (b : B), P (a, b)) -> forall p : A * B, P p
Relation_Operators.symprod_sind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A * B -> A * B -> SProp), (forall x x' : A, leA x x' -> forall y : B, P (x, y) (x', y)) -> (forall y y' : B, leB y y' -> forall x : A, P (x, y) (x, y')) -> forall p p0 : A * B, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB p p0 -> P p p0
Relation_Operators.symprod_ind : forall (A B : Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : B -> B -> Prop) (P : A * B -> A * B -> Prop), (forall x x' : A, leA x x' -> forall y : B, P (x, y) (x', y)) -> (forall y y' : B, leB y y' -> forall x : A, P (x, y) (x, y')) -> forall p p0 : A * B, Relation_Operators.symprod A B leA leB p p0 -> P p p0
SF_size_lx_ly : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s) = S (size (SF_ly s))
filter_ex : forall P0 : R -> Prop, Rbar_locally ?x P0 -> exists x : R, P0 x where ?x : [T : Type P : SF_seq -> Type |- Rbar]
belast = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | h :: s0 => seq.belast h s0 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
